pageContent: Introduction: A series of previously neglected sexually related side effects to radical prostatectomy (RP) has been identified over the recent years. These include orgasm-associated incontinence (OAI), urinary incontinence in relation to sexual stimulation (UISS), altered perception of orgasm, orgasm-associated pain (OAP), penile shortening (PS), and penile deformity.

metaData.source:
Measuring disease specific quality of life in localized prostate cancer: the Dutch experience
https://pubmed.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/12797718/
